thread.title: Snoop Dogg unveils weed website at tech conference
thread.title_full: Snoop Dogg unveils weed website at tech conference - MarketWatch

author: Kathleen Burke
title: Snoop Dogg unveils weed website at tech conference
text:
Calvin Broadus Jr., aka Snoop Dogg, introduced a new addition to his marijuana investments: his coming website Merry Jane .
The rap star made the announcement on Monday at the TechCrunch Disrupt conference in San Francisco. The three-day gathering brings together new startups, technologies and key figures in the tech industry. On stage, Snoop Dogg described the site as a media, education and entertainment site for marijuana enthusiasts.
Other big discussions at the conference included the development of a GoPro GPRO, -0.66% drone and Facebook’s FB, +0.38% “click to message” ads.
Snoop Dogg said the website is intended to be a comprehensive resource for all things marijuana, and will help bring the practice of cannabis consumption into the mainstream.
See also: Marijuana moms shatter the grass ceiling
“There are so many people in the closet, and we are giving them an opportunity to come out of the closet and just admit they like to smoke,” he said at the conference. “I’m a smoker, my name is Snoop Dogg, and I’m a stoner.”
Merry Jane will feature a cooking show on how to make marijuana edibles, editorial content and a cannabis strain and dispensary database. There will also be a show about people’s first experiences with marijuana, called “Deflowered,” with exclusive celebrity interviews with the likes of Miley Cyrus and Seth Rogen.
The website launched for beta testers on Monday, and is set to be open to the general public in the next few weeks.
Snoop Dogg’s marijuana-focused venture-capital firm, Casa Verde Capital, has also been investing in marijuana tech , including California cannabis delivery app Eaze.
